course.subject: MARK
course.name: Digital Marketing
course.description: Digital Marketing has reshaped the consumer landscape, and it is offering business new challenges and opportunities. In this course, students will learn important concepts related to digital marketing, factors that facilitate effective digital marketing initiative, and a consumer-centric approach to develop marketing plans. Students will also have hands-on experiences with web analytics and other real-life examples.

reviews.author: Roccolai
reviews.comment_content:
Topic Outline
1. Understanding digital marketing and digital environment
2. Web design
3. Search engine optimization
4. Web analytics
5. Google analytics and google ads
6. Social media marketing
7. Display and e-mail advertising
8. Text analysis
9. Digital marketing strategy
10. New and future trends in digital marketing

Learning Activities
- Lectures & discussions
- Exercises: Text mining, Case studies
- Personal Assignments: Google Analytics and Google Ads
- Group Projects
- Exams
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal grading
Maybe curve based.
Evaluation Criteria
Class participation (10 points) Personal assignments (10 points)
- Certifications: 8 points
- Research credit: 2 points
Group project (20 points)
- Mini project presentation: 5 points
- Final project paper: 10 points
- Final project presentation: 5 points
Exams (60 points)
- Mid-term exam: 30 points
- Final exam: 30 points

reviews.author: Anakin Kwok
reviews.title: Good Prof
reviews.comment_content:
Topic Outline
1. Understanding digital marketing and digital environment
2. Web design
3. Search engine optimization
4. Web analytics
5. Google analytics and google ads
6. Social media marketing
7. Display and e-mail advertising
8. Text analysis
9. Digital marketing strategy
10. New and future trends in digital marketing
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Quite easy to understand
- Interactive learning
- Would include some heated topics into the teaching content (eg. ChatGPT), making the class fun to attend
reviews.comment_grading:
Evaluation Criteria
Class participation (10 points)
Personal assignments (8 points)
- Certifications: 6 points
- Research credit: 2 points
Group project (22 points)
- Mini project presentation: 8 points
- Final project presentation: 14 points
Exams (60 points)
- Mid-term exam: 30 points
- Final exam: 30 points
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy when compared to other courses. But there are 2 groups projects to handle throughout the semester. The mini project requires you to read some researches and to summarise. Then you have to think how to apply those concepts into digital marketing. The large group project requires you to improve a firm's digital marketing. As long as each group member is willing to contribute, the workload is acceptable. But you have to be working really hard to get very good grades.

reviews.author: ntt
reviews.title: Prof Park is good!
reviews.comment_content:
Quite practical and easy to understand. A good start for anyone that would like to gain a higher-level view of how digital marketing works.

Topic Outline
1. Understanding digital marketing and digital environment
2. Web design
3. Search engine optimization
4. Web analytics
5. Google analytics and google ads
6. Social media marketing
7. Display and e-mail advertising
8. Text analysis
9. Digital marketing strategy
10. New and future trends in digital marketing
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Park always tries to keep classes fun and interactive.
reviews.comment_grading:
Evaluation Criteria
Class participation (10 points)
Personal assignments (10 points)
- Certifications: 8 points
- Research credit: 2 points
Group project (20 points)
- Mini project presentation: 5 points
- Final project paper: 10 points
- Final project presentation: 5 points
Exams (60 points)
- Mid-term exam: 30 points
- Final exam: 30 points
reviews.comment_workload:
Class participation:
Just like most marketing courses, you would have to attend class to gain class participation, but only need to make at least 7 participations throughout the sem

Certifications:
2 certs from Google - Prof will be reminding you when to take them to align with the modules but you're given the flexibility to choose to complete them anytime by sem end

Project:
Workload's normal (IF you don't run into free-riders) and topics are fun

Exams:
Closed-book MC and short answer. Study the slides well and you will be fine.

reviews.author: Im good student
reviews.title: Good Grade Course
reviews.comment_content:
Topic Outline
1. Understanding digital marketing and digital environment
2. Web design
3. Search engine optimization  
4. Web analytics
5. Google analytics and google ads
6. Social media marketing
7. Display and e-mail advertising
8. Text analysis
9. Digital marketing strategy
10. New and future trends in digital marketing

Useful content. Really teach you how SEM/SEO works. Recommend this course if wanna have some intro knowledge of digital marketing tools like Google Ad, Google Analytic, and Python (text analysis). Prof provided many fun & famous example each lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Park is handsome and energetic. He always smile and encourage everyone to speak during the lesson.

He is very helpful. I have some technical issue in the Python lesson and missed all the step from the beginning. He stayed for 1 hr to help me fix it after lesson and highlight the content for me. He is really soooo nice TvT. I sent email to clarify some content before exam and he replied in detail within 24 hr.
reviews.comment_grading:
1.  Class participation (10 points)
2.  Personal assignments (10 points)
     - Certifications: 8 points
     - Research credit: 2 points
3.  Group project (20 points)
     - Mini project presentation: 5 points
     - Final project paper: 10 points
     - Final project presentation: 5 points
4.  Exams (60 points)
     - Mid-term exam: 30 points
     - Final exam: 30 points

My final grade is A-.

Mid Term Stat: (total: 30)
Mean: 22.13
Median: 22 High: 28
Upper Quartile: 25 Low: 14
Lower Quartile: 20

Final Exam Stat: (total: 30)
Mean: 23.7
Median: 24 High: 29
Upper Quartile: 26 Low: 17
Lower Quartile: 21
reviews.comment_workload:
Exam are easy, all question are MC and very straight forward. Just try ur best rmb all the ppt content is ok. I used 1.5 days to study and got 26/30 & 27/30 for each exam. I thought the upper quartile would be higher tbh.

I only voice up twice for the whole semester, so I believe my participation is quite low.

Everyone got 10/10 for personal assignments. Don't missed the deadline is ok. 8 point goes to 2 SEM related certifications offered by Google.

Group project is about reading a marketing paper and present it to the class at the end of the semester. Not everyone need to present. It is fun to hear other group's sharing. Learned many interesting tactics of digital marketing.

Workload is quite low for me.
